metadata.Title: CVE-2022-20423 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
In rndis_set_response of rndis.c, there is a possible out of bounds writedue to an integer overflow. This could lead to local escalation ofprivilege if a malicious USB device is attached with no additionalexecution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed forexploitation.Product: AndroidVersions: Android kernelAndroid ID:A-239842288References: Upstream kernel

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-20423` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-2.16
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-184-generic - 4.15.0-184.194~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-184-generic - 4.15.0-184.194~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-184-lowlatency - 4.15.0-184.194~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1094-kvm - 4.4.0-1004.9
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-2.16').
linux-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-184.194~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in esm-infra/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1004.9').

linux-gcp package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1127.142~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oracle package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1098.108~16.04.1').
